DOC.brief_summary: Until recently , bulb catheter oronasopharyngeal suctioning ( ONPS ) infant , include vigorous infant delivery room , featured standard newborn care . The 5th edition Newborn Resuscitation Program ( NRP ) minimize recommendation routine suction infant follow delivery , provide depress need immediate resuscitation . However , new alternative recommendation base small randomize trial lower level evidence rather evidence large trial . The NRP Textbook caution vigorous suction resultant apnea bradycardia . Furthermore , suction may delay important step resuscitation . Thus , necessary compare alternative recommend practice , i.e . simple wipe mouth , determine equivalent efficacy favorable side effect profile compare suctioning .
DOC.brief_title: Oronasopharyngeal Suction Versus Simple Nose Mouth Wiping Term Newborns
